episodes.title: Everyone Looks a Little Grown Up After Spring Break
episodes.plot: Shinpachi returns after vacation to find that everyone around him has changed and moved on.

episodes.title: Everyone Looks Pretty Grown Up After Summer Break
episodes.plot: Shinpachi is a loner in a strange new world, but finds an unexpected ally to help him out.

episodes.title: Use a Calligraphy Pen for New Year's Cards/The Heart Comes Before Chocolate
episodes.plot: As Gintoki complains of writing News Years cards, Yorozuya learn of what their friends have done over the holidays. In the second part it's Valentine's Day and Kagura is having trouble with giving her chocolate to Gintoki and Shinpachi.

episodes.title: Meals Should Be Balanced/We Are All Warriors in the Battle Against Fate
episodes.plot: Yamazaki suffers from an Anpan related breakdown while on a surveillance job. Kondo finally gets a date.

episodes.title: It's Too Confusing When Talking About the Poster Girl for a Poster Store, So Call Her a Sandwich Board
episodes.plot: Catherine gets engaged to one of the regulars at Snack Otose and it seems like this has changed her whole character.

episodes.title: Glasses Are Part of the Soul
episodes.plot: Sachan's glasses get broken and she needs them replaced. She's overjoyed when Gintoki buys her new ones and refuses to take them off, despite the fact that they're the wrong prescription.

episodes.title: Glasses Prevent You from Seeing Certain Things
episodes.plot: The Yorozuya and Zenzo protect Sachan from an elite group of assassins sent to eliminate her, after her new glasses cause her to bungle her job.

episodes.title: Nothing Lasts Forever, Including Parents, Money, Youth, Your Room, Dress Shirts, Me, You, and the Gintama Anime
episodes.plot: A recap filler episode that includes Hasegawa's "Carboard" song, a fake movie trailer and a segment of "Teach us Ginpachi-sensei".

episodes.title: Outrageous Cities Are Full of Gathering Places for Yahoo Type Guys
episodes.plot: Pirako Chin has come to town looking for the strongest man in the Kabukicho. Gintoki now finds himself with an unwanted underling who wants to paint the town blood red.

episodes.title: Ghosts Aren't the Only Ones Who Go Crazy in Graveyards
episodes.plot: Pirako reveals her real plan to start a war between the four gangs of Kabukicho and help her father take over the town.

episodes.title: Chains of Chivalry
episodes.plot: In the aftermath of Otose's attack, Gintama considers disbanding his business and leaving, but his friends convince him to fight back.

episodes.title: Iron Town
episodes.plot: Male escorts vs. drag queens, cabaret girls vs. Yakuza, robots blowing things up. Everybody is out in full force. It's an all-out war in the Kabuki district.

episodes.title: 'Tis an Honor!
episodes.plot: Teruhiko is rescued by Catharine, Shinpachi and Kagura. For the promises with Tatsugoro, Gintoki and Jirocho continue fighting against the mercenary soldiers Kada hired.

episodes.title: Odds or Even
episodes.plot: Takasugi, ally of the Harusame Space Pirates, and Kamui, captain of their 7th Division get caught up in some internal politics.

episodes.title: I Can't Remember a Damn Thing About the Factory Tour
episodes.plot: The Patriot, a device that has no use other than to give people a form of purpose in life, catches on.

episodes.title: What Happens Twice Can Happen Thrice
episodes.plot: The Odd Jobs get hired as lifeguards at the city pool. But they manage to scare everybody away, until its just the regular group of misfits left.

episodes.title: The Claws of a Crab Can Snip Through a Friendship
episodes.plot: Gintoki, Shinpachi and Kagura prepare to eat crabs. Each of them want to eat more than the others as much as possible, so they use some dirty tricks.

episodes.title: People Forget to Return Stuff All the Time Without Even Realizing It
episodes.plot: A former professional boxer Iwamatsu is punched on the street as his job now. He and Kagura get to know each other. / Gintoki and Shinpachi encounter Kondou, Hijikata and Okita in a public bath.

episodes.title: The Bathhouse, Where You're Naked in Body and Soul
episodes.plot: Gintoki and Shinpachi and the Shinsengumi leaders vie for private use of a bathhouse, but must work together to survive when Hedoro and his family come to use the bathhouse themselves.

episodes.title: Jugem
episodes.plot: The house of Tokugawa leaves nameless baby monkey with the house of Yagyuu. Kyuubei takes care of monkey, she wants to give a lucky name that she, Tae and Yorozuya think of.

episodes.title: The Name Reveals the Person
episodes.plot: The baby monkey escapes from Kyuubei. She and her friends make efforts to look for the baby monkey.

episodes.title: The Man's Household Situation Is Hard, His Heart Is Soft
episodes.plot: Katsura goes undercover as a maid in the Shinsengumi Comissioner's house, only to aid Matsudaira in mending his relationship with his daughter.

episodes.title: Blue and Red Ecstasy
episodes.plot: Gintoki trades in a broken VHS player at a recycle shop for a modern Blu-ray player. However, there's a cursed disc stuck inside.

episodes.title: So in the Second Season of Prison Break, They're Already Broken Out of Prison, But the Name Works Once You Realize That Society Is a Prison
episodes.plot: Yorozuya has a odd job that they collect bills from a male customer who wears a uniform of warder. Actually, he is a real warden, and Gintoki is arrested by him without due cause.

episodes.title: Everybody Loves Pajamas
episodes.plot: Gintoki investigates that chief-guard keep something a secret with Shachi.

episodes.title: Speaking of Crossovers, Don't Forget About Alien vs. Predator
episodes.plot: This story is collaboration with a manga "Sket Dance". Bossun, Himeko and Switch come to world of "Gintama" by mysterious power.

episodes.title: Love Is Neither Plus Nor Minus
episodes.plot: Shinpachi introduces his new girlfriend, but she turns out to be a character from a popular video game.

episodes.title: Making It Through Love
episodes.plot: Gintama and Shinpachi end up in a tournament to see who can be the best cyber-lover.

episodes.title: It Would Take Too Much Effort to Make This Title Sound Like a Text Message Subject
episodes.plot: Kagura becomes a compulsive email-sender since she got a cellphone by accident. Gintoki and Shinpachi are fed up with her emails.

episodes.title: When You Go to a Funeral for the First Time, You're Surprised by How Happy the People Are
episodes.plot: Gintoki and Hijikata attend the funeral of a chef and well-known acquaintance, only for the funeral to get out of hand.

episodes.title: The People You Tend to Forget Tend to Show Up After You Forget About Them
episodes.plot: Elizabeth was missing, Katsura asks Yorozuya for help. Soon later, Katsura remembers Elizabeth's identity while he talks with Gintoki.

episodes.title: Space Ururun Homestay
episodes.plot: Tatsuma and Mutsu rescue Yorozuya, Katsura and Fumiko. Fumiko reveals that an awful strategy of Lord Beida, a leader of Renhou.

episodes.title: Piggy Banks and Trash Cans
episodes.plot: With the help of Fumiko, Yorozuya, Katsura and Tatsuma infiltrate into Renhou's mothership to look for Elizabeth.

episodes.title: Empty Planet
episodes.plot: Elizabeth rises in rebellion against Lord Beida for his beloved people.

episodes.title: Don't Say Good-bye, Lionel
episodes.plot: The giant robot of Kaientai, KaiÃªn confronts the giant robot White-Lucifer.

episodes.title: Please Take Me Skiing
episodes.plot: Shinsengumi guards that shogun Shigeshige travels incognito for skiing. They encounter Yorozuya, Otae, and Katsura at the same ski resort.

episodes.title: A Vacation in Disorientation
episodes.plot: Gintoki and his friends meet with an accident in the snowy mountain while they look for Shigeshige who was missing.

episodes.title: You Know Those Year-end Parties Where You Keep Drinking Until You've Forgotten Everything That Happened the Past Year? There Are a Few Things You're Not Supposed to Forget
episodes.plot: A year-end party takes place. After a night of heavy drinking, Gintoki wakes up to learn he slept with six people, who all demand him to take responsibility.

episodes.title: People Can Only Live by Forgetting the Bad
episodes.plot: Gintoki tries to keep his harem happy by going on a date with all of them.

episodes.title: We Are All Hosts, in Capital Letters
episodes.plot: Yorozuya asks Kyoushirou for help about a good customer of a host-club Takamagahara.

episodes.title: Girls Love Vegeta, Guys Like Piccolo
episodes.plot: Gintoki and his friends must keep the host bar orderly as a special Madame arrives for dinner, even though it is in the midst of chaos.

episodes.title: Draw Your Life on the Canvas We Call Manga
episodes.plot: Honda is now editor of manga "Ginta-man". He concentrates his efforts to discover new talented person.One day,a man called himself as No.N3016 comes to Honda to show unsolicited manuscripts of manga.

episodes.title: Check It Out!
episodes.plot: Shinsengumi accepts Tetsunosuke Sasaki as trainee. He is from the house of Sasaki clan that is a distinguished family, it's notable that his older brother Isaburou Sasaki is a leader of Mimawarigumi. But Tetsunosuke has bad behavior, so Hijikata gets irritated.

episodes.title: Thornies and Rosies
episodes.plot: Tetsunosuke mends his ways, and takes a positive attitude toward working. Isaburou still treats Tetsunosuke like an enemy, and advises that Hijikata had better throw him out of Shinsengumi.

episodes.title: Festival of Thornies
episodes.plot: Tetsunosuke is taken prisoner by the radical Joi group. Isaburou thinks that his team beats them, ignoring Tetsunosuke.

episodes.title: Letter from Thorny
episodes.plot: Shinsengumi heads for Tetsunosuke to save. Mimawarigumi confronts them.

episodes.title: Madaodog Madaonaire
episodes.plot: Taizou Hasegawa aka Madao makes appearance in the quiz show in an unexpected turn of events. How much can he win? ...Is that your final answer?

episodes.title: Presents Are Meant to Be Given Early
episodes.plot: The demon Gedomaru comes to the Yorozuya for help on how to give good presents to friends.

episodes.title: New Year's Envelopes Are Perfect for Dirty Jokes
episodes.plot: There is a custom called Otoshidama that children receive gifts of money from their parents and relatives at the New Year. Kagura heard such a story, and then she begs Gintoki for it.

episodes.title: When Sleeping Under a Kotatsu, Make Sure You Don't Burn Your Balls
episodes.plot: The Kotatsu placed Yorozuya office gets out of order. Gintoki goes to buy a new at a secondhand shop.

episodes.title: We're Sorry
episodes.plot: It's 5th season finale! Yorozuya apologizes to cause some upsetting situations in real world by behaving in selfish manner.
